block.p: Peter Nicol of England, the top-ranked player in the world and the top-seeded men's player in the Harrisdirect Tournament of Champions, advanced to the final yesterday, outlasting David Palmer of Australia, 15-8, 9-15, 15-12, 15-10, in a semifinal match at Grand Central Terminal.

Nicol will play Theirry Lincou of France in the final tonight. Lincou was an upset winner over the Canadian Jonathon Power, the tournament's defending champion. Lincou, seeded sixth, lost the first game, 15-5, before taking the next three. Lincou outscored Power by 30-10 over the last two games.

Peter Nicol of England, the top-ranked player in the world and the top-seeded men's player in the Harrisdirect Tournament of Champions, advanced to the final yesterday, outlasting David Palmer of Australia, 15-8, 9-15, 15-12, 15-10, in a semifinal match at Grand Central Terminal.

Nicol will play Theirry Lincou of France in the final tonight. Lincou was an upset winner over the Canadian Jonathon Power, the tournament's defending champion. Lincou, seeded sixth, lost the first game, 15-5, before taking the next three. Lincou outscored Power by 30-10 over the last two games.
In the women's event, second-seeded Natalie Pohrer advanced to face top-seeded Carol Owens of New Zealand in tonight's final.

Pohrer, an American citizen by way of South Africa, made short work of Cassie Jackman of England, winning by 9-4, 9-3, 9-2 in just 36 minutes. Jackman, a former world champion who is coming off back surgery, was never in the match.
Owens easily won the first two games, 9-4, 9-0, against Tania Bailey of England before Bailey withdrew because of illness.
